prompt:
Context: "the U.S. Borrower shall repay principal of outstanding Initial Dollar Term Loans
on the last day of each March, June, September and December of each year (commencing on June
30, 2022) and on the Initial Term Facility Maturity Date or, if any such date is not a Business Day,
on the immediately preceding Business Day (each such date being referred to as an “Initial Dollar
Term Loan Installment Date”), in an aggregate principal amount of such Initial Dollar Term Loans
equal to (A) in the case of any Initial Dollar Term Loan Installment Date prior to the Initial Term
Facility Maturity Date, 0.25% of the aggregate principal amount of the Initial Dollar Term Loans
incurred on the Closing Date, and (B) in the case of such payment due on the Initial Term Facility
Maturity Date, an amount equal to the then unpaid principal amount of such Initial Dollar Term
Loans outstanding; and"

Question: "When will Borrower  repay principal of Dollar Term Loans?"

Answer:
response: The U.S. Borrower will repay principal of outstanding Initial Dollar Term Loans on the last day of each March, June, September, and December of each year, starting from June 30, 2022, and on the Initial Term Facility Maturity Date, or the immediately preceding Business Day if such date is not a Business Day. These dates are referred to as Initial Dollar Term Loan Installment Dates. The amount of principal repaid on each Initial Dollar Term Loan Installment Date will be equal to 0.25% of the aggregate principal amount of the Initial Dollar Term Loans incurred on the Closing Date, prior to the Initial Term Facility Maturity Date, and an amount equal to the then unpaid principal amount of such Initial Dollar Term Loans outstanding on the Initial Term Facility Maturity Date.
